1. TRADITIONAL CAO LAU NOODLE FACTORY 

üçúCAO LAU NOODLES: Soak the rice for 24 hours then grind it. Cook and stir until thick for 30 minutes.
Steam for 30 minutes. Roll to make it flat and steam. 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. Qu√°n Cao L·∫ßu B√° L·ªÖ

üçúCAO LAU: In a bowl, add herbs, bean sprouts, cao lau noodles, char siu, ch·∫£ ram, deep fried pork fat (t·ªëp m·ª°) then meat sauce.

3. PH·ªû S·∫ÆN FACTORY

üçú PH·ªû S·∫ÆN: Grind the dried cassava into powder. Soak the cassava powder and water for 3 days and 3 nights then filter the water out, keeping the cassava powder. Whisk the cassava mixture in a pot for 30 minutes. Smooth mixture out. Place batter in a pressing machine. Dry noodles in the sun. After drying, cut into squares. 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. NH√Ä H√ÄNG C·ªé H·ªíNG

üçúFRIED PH·ªû S·∫ÆN: Pestle the pearl onions and place vegetables in hot water. Make the sauce with fish sauce, vinegar, msg, and coconut nectar. In a pan, add peanut oil. Fry the garlic, shrimp, and squid, add sugar, and then the vegetables. Add water and add a little starch. In another pan, deep-fry the pho san noodles. In a bowl, add the fried pho san, sauce, shrimp, squid, and top with spring onions.

üçúPH·ªû S·∫ÆN WITH FISH BROTH: Cook snakehead fish broth for 5 hours. Break the pho san into pieces and soak them in cold water for one minute. Place oil in a pot, add in pearl onions, garlic, tumeric, and the snakehead fish, and fry it for 10 minutes. Add in the pork. Pestle the fish. Add in the broth and cook
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

snippet.description:

1. LONG NECK  KAREN VILLAGE
ADDRESS: Chiang Mai Thailand
üáπüá≠WRAPPED STICKY RICE & BANANA: Soak rice overnight. Place rice and banana on a banana leaf and wrap it tightly. Boil for 2 hours.
üáπüá≠SAUSAGES: Mix together roasted Makwan,  roasted chilies, mashed Makwan & chili, minced pork, minced pig kidney, minced spring onion, coriander, and cilantro. Season with salt and powder. Stuffed the mix to pig organs and tie the ends. Boil for an hour and then roast for an hour.
üáπüá≠ VEGETABLE CURRY: Boil water and add in pumpkin, potatoes, bamboo shoots, green beans, and green mustard. Season with salt & powder.
üáπüá≠ MINCED CHICKEN IN BIANJAI LEAF: Minced the whole chicken and then add minced peanuts, spring onions, coriander, and cilantro. Seasoning with turmeric, white chives, Thai chili, Makwan, salt, and powder. Add filling in Bianjai leaf and wrap. Boil for two hours.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  
1. KAREN VILLAGE
ADDRESS: Wiang Pa Pao, Chiang Rai 100 KM. North of CM City
üáπüá≠ROASTED RICE CAKE: Mash steamed rice in a stone pot. Roast for 5 minutes on each side.
üáπüá≠ROASTED FROG: Clean the whole frog and leave to dry for a couple days. Roast over fire for 15 minutes. Make the chili sauce with roasted garlic, tomato, chili, salt and herbs.
üáπüá≠ FRIED CRICKETS: In a frying pan, add oil and then add the crickets. Fry for about 5 minutes and remove from fire. Add in Kaffir lime and fry.
üáπüá≠ GRILLED TARANTULA: Place the dried tarantulas on the grill and let them grill for about 20 minutes.
üáπüá≠CALADRUM CURRY: Clean liver and lungs. Slice them into small pieces. Stir with garlic, shallots, easoning salt, fermented pepper paste and turmeric garlic and mix. Add in water, then root herb and blood. Let it boil until it is thick. Add in kaffir, lemongrass, spring onions, cilantro, coriander and seasoning powder.
üáπüá≠BLACK PIG:  In a mortar, mash coriander, garlic and turmeric. Mix them together. Add seasoning inside of the pig and rub. Place pig on fire. Place belly down and rub with more seasoning on back. Leave belly down for about 10 mins. Flip it often during the 6-hour roast.

1. BUTCHER SHOP
ADDRESS: 87 Baan Patan, T. San Pakwan, A. Hang Dong, Chiang Mai
OPENING HOURS: 8AM-4PM

PRICE: PREMIUM BILE B300 THB / $8.70 USD 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. CHANG KHAM NOI
ADDRESS: Hang Dong, Chiang Mai 50230
OPENING HOURS: 7AM-5PM

üáπüá≠YAMHOK (Buffalo Placenta Soup): Boil with lemongrass and add herbs, placenta, and seasonings like golango, turmeric and pan dan leaves, chicken stock and shrimp paste. Allow it to boil for 30 minutes. Remove the placenta and chop. Place in a bowl and add broth, and homemade pepper paste, and mix. Add local herbs and shallots. 

üáπüá≠LAAB: Add fresh blood to sliced meat and mince it together. Add in tenderloin, bile mix, chili powder, spring onions, coriander. Add in about 15-20 types of Thai ingredients mashed: cumin seeds, peppers, anise, coriander seed, etc, and mix. Add in premium bile and buffalo fat on top. 

PRICE: YAMHOK - B100 / $2.18 USD | LAAB - B65 = $1.80 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. LUU CAFE
ADDRESS: 221 Soi Hang San, Ban Waen, Hang Dong District, Chiang Mai 50230
OPENING HOURS: 4PM-9PM

üáπüá≠LUU (Raw Pig Blood Soup): In a bowl, add filtered blood with lemongrass, and drain it. Add in sliced pork skin & kidneys. Add in spring onions, coriander, fermented garlic juice, fried garlic, fried organs, fried kaffir, Thai chili powder. Serve with fried clear noodles on top

PRICE: B40 = $1.10 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. KRUA PHETDOINGAM SAWASDEE JAO
ADDRESS: 125/3‡∏°.2 Mahidol Rd, Pa Daet Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand
OPENING HOURS: 10AM‚Äì10:30PM

üáπüá≠JAM KAI MOT DHAENG: Sauce: lime, rice roasted powder, chili, and red ant‚Äôs eggs. Add in purple onions, coriander, cilantro, and spring onions and mix them all together. Top with basil and fresh chilies on top.

PRICE: B300 = $8.40 USD

üáµüá≠LECHON KAWALI: Boil the pork bellies for 1.5 hours. Marinate in rock salt for 2 hours, then deep-fry for 30 minutes. Chop the meat into slices and eat with rice, papaya, and sweet sauce (soy sauce, vinegar, cassava flour, and sugar).

Serve with sauce (pork liver paste, bread crumbs, vinegar, sugar, garlic, onions, bacon fat, salt, and pepper)

üí∏PRICE: 8000 PHP / $144.32 USD

üáµüá≠LOMI: In a pot with oil, add chopped garlic and onions then add the broth (made from boiling pig jaws for 5+ hours). Add soy sauce, black pepper and seasonings. Boil the egg noodles. Add coconut milk and mix well. Add in eggs. Cook until it gets thick, then serve in a bowl. In a bowl, add hard boiled eggs, roasted pork, liver, lumpia (fried spring rolls), ground pork, chinese kikiam, fish balls, chicharon and fried garlic on top. 

üí∏PRICE: 95 PHP/ $1.70 USD 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. D‚ÄôORIGINAL WALASTIK PARES NI KABAYAN
ADDRESS: 7317 J Victor, Makati, Kalakhang Manila 

üáµüá≠PARES: Boil water and then add penises, testicles, intestines, towels, stomachs, hearts, livers, ovaries, eyes, skin, knees, thighs, brain (in plastic bag), bone marrow, jaws, and then cook for 5 hours. Season with onions, garlic, celery, green chilies, ginger, pepper and salt. Boil for another hour. Add milk mixture, then liquid seasoning, soy sauce and fried garlic. Serve with rice.﻿

üí∏PRICE: 60 PHP/ $1.07 USD for basic bowl
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

üáµüá≠PANCIT PALABOK: Boil water then add in pork bones and cook for a couple hours. Add flour, corn starch, eggs, then season with salt, pepper, fried garlic, MSG and achuete. Place noodles in the dish, and then pour in broth. Add chicharon, fried pig stomachs, achuete fried tofu, crushed chicharon, hard boiled eggs, and green onions on top. ﻿

üí∏PRICE: 70 PHP / $1.25 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

ADDRESS: 201 Gen. Luna St, Malabon, Metro Manila
INTERVIEWEE:

üáµüá≠PANSIT BIHON: Stir-fry glass noodles and add egg noodles cooked in pork broth. Add carrots, celery, cabbages, chayote,  fish balls, pork marinated with soy sauce, pepper and MSG. 

üáµüá≠TORTANG ALIMASAG: Make an omelette with crab meat, carrots, bell peppers, onions, garlic, salt, soy sauce, oyster sauce and bay leaves.

üáµüá≠SISIG AND FRIED PAPAYA WITH SHRIMP DIPPED IN VINEGAR

ADDRESS: Francisco St, Angeles, Pampanga

üáµüá≠FRIED CHICKEN HEADS: Coat the chicken heads in flour then deep-fry. Chop the heads in half then serve with vinegar sauce (onions, chilli and vinegar) and sweet sauce.

snippet.description:

1. FAMILY HOME IN KARIM ABAD 

üáµüá∞ CHAPATI & OMELETTE 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. KARIM ABAD, HUNZA VALLEY - GILGIT

üáµüá∞ BOILED YAK MEAT: Boil the meat for at least 3 hours in a broth with onions, ginger, garlic and salt

üáµüá∞ YAK KEBABS: Marinate the meat with ginger-garlic juice, red chili powder, salt, lemon juice, garlic powder, vinegar and cooking oil. Skewer the meat and grill on charcoal for 30 minutes. Add cooking oil along the way.

üáµüá∞YAK PULAO: Let rice sit in hot water for 30 minutes. Add the backbone meat and lower abdomen meat to a separate pot and cook for 30 minutes. Add onions, carrots, cumin, cumin leaves, tomato, pulao spices, chicken powder, coconut flesh, almonds, raisins, and sugar. Add the Yak stock (the water in the boiled yak pot). Add rice to this pot, cover it with a lid and cook for 20 more minutes. Put charcoal on the lid and continue cooking for another 20 minutes.

üáµüá∞YAK MEAT WITH POTATOES: Place the meat in the pot. Add chopped onions, then a ginger-garlic salt mixture, and curry powder. Cover the pot and let it cook for 1.5 hours. Add tomatoes and potatoes. Let it cook simmer for 30 minutes and it's ready to serve.

üáµüá∞ FRIED YAK HEART AND LIVER: Chop up the heart and the liver. Marinate with salt, ginger & garlic juice, lemon juice, and tika (BBQ spices). Mix well. Let it absorb the marination for 30 minutes. Deep fry for 5 minutes.

snippet.title: RARE Pakistani Village Food!! The Mountain People of Hunza!!
snippet.description:
üé• SECOND CHANNEL!! MORE BEFRS ¬ª http://bit.ly/MoreBEFRS 
üëï BEFRS MERCH ¬ª https://bit.ly/ShopBEFRS

Like our music? Enjoy a free 30-day of Epidemic Sound for the best royalty-free music: http://share.epidemicsound.com/BEFRS 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
1. SADIA‚ÄôS HOUSE

üáµüá∞ APRICOT KERNEL SEED SOUP: Add water to the pot, smash the apricot kernels and add into the pot with add salt, and stir. Prepare the dough by adding salt to wheat flour, then mixing it with chicken eggs. Knead the dough and cut it into small short strings. Add the noodles to the soup pot and cook for 7 mins.﻿

üáµüá∞ DRIED APRICOT DAWDO SOUP: Add dried apricots to hot water and grounded dough. Cook for 15 minutes.

üáµüá∞ GUR-E-GIALING: Make the batter with flour, eggs, water, and apricot oil. Add local butter to the hot pan, and use a piece of dough to spread it all over the pan. Pour the batter in the pan, and flip it a couple of times to cook both sides of the pancake.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. HUNZA FOOD PAVILION
ADDRESS: Baltit Fort Road, Near Polo Ground, Karimabad Hunza

üáµüá∞CHAPSURO: Knead the wheat dough into a round-shape. Add the filling mixture made with local chicken meat, coriander, mint, onion, green chilies, salt, and saffron. Cover it with another layer of dough then cook it in a hot pan. When it‚Äôs ready, cut it into small pieces and serve with panir (goat cheese).

üáµüá∞MULIDA: Make chapati bread and tear it into little pieces. Add water to a pot, and add dried cow cheese, dried mint, salt, coriander, onions, green chilies, and chapati. Serve with apricot oil.

üáµüá∞GIR GIR ALOO: Add the paste made from coriander, mint, and green chilies in a pot. Stir-fry it well. Add masala, water, brown lentil, salt, and potatoes. Cook for 20 minutes.

üí∏PRICE: Chapsuro + Gir gir aloo - 350 PKR / $1.88 each | Mulida - 200 PKR / $1.07 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. NASIRA‚ÄôS FAMILY HOUSE

üáµüá∞CHEESE CHAPATI: Make paste from cottage cow cheese, coriander, green onions, walnuts, salt and a little of milk. Make chapati and spread the paste on it. Serve with apricot oil.

üáµüá∞ BUCKWHEAT PANCAKES: Wipe pan with a piece of onion, add buckwheat batter in the pan and cook till it's done.

üáµüá∞MANTU: Make dough from wheatflour. Make filling using minced chicken, coriander, green onions, and green chilies and ground red chilies. Wrap the dough around the filling and steam them for 15 minutes. Apply olive oil before steaming. ﻿

üáµüá∞CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP: Add olive oil in the pot placed on the stove. Add some chopped onions, ground ginger and garlic. Add minced chicken, ginger, salt, one litre of water, green onions and coriander in the pot. On the other side, roll the wheat flour to make noodles. Add the noodles in the pot.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
1. MR. MUZAFFAR TARRAR‚ÄôS HOUSE

üáµüá∞PARATHA WITH POTATO FILLING: Make paratha bread from the dough, then fill it up with the paste of mashed potatoes, coriander, green chili, pomegranate, salt, and red chili powder. Cook it in a hot pan with local butter that was made from lassi.

üáµüá∞ PARATHA WITH RADISH FILLING: Make paratha bread from the dough, then fill it up with the paste of minced radish, coriander, green chili, pomegranate, salt, and red chili powder. Cook it in a hot pan till it's done.

üáµüá∞ PARATHA WITH MAITHRA: Make paratha bread from the dough, then fill it up with the paste of maithra vegetable, coriander, green chili, pomegranate, salt, and red chili powder. Cook it in a hot pan with local butter. 

üáµüá∞LASSI: Leave Dasi yogurt to sit and condense for 30 minutes in a traditional wooden and clay pot. Stir the lassi out of it. Add more liquid yogurt, water, and ice along the way.

üáµüá∞WHOLE GOAT COOKED UNDERGROUND: Cook the rice with salt, dried coriander seeds, cinnamon, black pepper, dried plums, and water. Filter the water out of the rice.  Prepare the masala to marinate the goat: yogurt, lemon juice, chili powder, turmeric powder, black and white pepper, fresh garlic, and fresh ginger. Stuff the goat with masala, rice, raisins, almonds, and walnuts. Add masala all over it. Sew the stomach. Stick the goat‚Äôs arms back to his body and tie the feet together. Place it underground and cook it for 4 hours.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. BY DEIRA TUBE WELL 

üáµüá∞GHUR:  Add cane juice intp a giant Karah (big steel pan), stir and cook for 6 hours until it's condensed and edible. Add baking soda and local butter. Add almonds, pistachios, raisins, and melon seeds to the giant mold. Add ghur to the mold and mix together. 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. LOCAL JALEBI SHOP

üáµüá∞JALEBI: Mix baking powder, wheat flour, and sugar liquid together and deep fry in cooking oil.

üí∏PRICE: 250 PKR / $1.3 per kg

1. ALSEHAT CORNER TEMPLE
ADDRESS: Temple Rd, Park Lane, Mozang, Mozang Chungi, Lahore, Punjab
OPENING TIMES: 5AM - 11AM
INTERVIEWEE: Mohammed Haneef

üáµüá∞GOAT FEET, HEAD & TONGUE STEW: Wash goat feet, goat head, goat brain and place them in a huge pot to boil. Add the spices: black pepper, red chili powder, cumin, lemon, cedar smoke flavor, and then cooking oil. Boil for 4 hours and then leave on low heat for another hour. Serve with wheat bread, lassi, and butter. 

üí∏PRICE: Small Feet - PKR 550/$2.95 USD | Big feet - PKR 650/$3.49 USD | Brain - PKR 350/$1.88 USD | Head - PKR 600/$3.22 USD |Tongue - PKR 250/$1.34 USD | Cheeks - PKR 350/$1.88 USD | Lassi - PKR 90/$0.48 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. PHAJA SIRI PAYE
ADDRESS: Kali Beri Bazar, near Taj Mahal Sweetÿå Walled City of Lahore, Lahore, Punjab, Pakistan

üáµüá∞GOAT TROTTER PAYE: Place the trotter/foot in a bowl and add the broth and masala. Serve with naan. 

üí∏PRICE: PKR +400 / +$2.15 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. ARIF RESTAURANT
OPENING TIME: 10AM - 4AM 

üáµüá∞MUTTON STOMACH: Cut the stomach into smaller pieces. Cook in a broth made with garam masala (warm spices: cinnamon & cumin). Add a lot of onion, garlic, oil, and fenugreek. Cook it for 6 hours. In a hot pan, add garlic, black pepper, and coriander then fry.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. SHAH CHICKEN TAWA ROAST
ADDRESS: Qadimi Shehr, Lahore, Punjab, Pakistan
OPENING TIME: 4PM - 4AM 

üáµüá∞BRAIN, TESTICLES,  HEART & RIBS: Cut brain, testicles, hearts and ribs into small pieces. Place in water and add garlic, then allow it to cook.  After 5 minutes, add more water and then change the water. Chop the meat into smaller pieces. Add julienned ginger and more water then steam. Open the cover and add tomato paste with green chilies & black pepper. Mix everything together then add yogurt & cream. Steam for a few minutes. Split the rip bones, and chop it into fine pieces. After 5 minutes, add 13 pieces of butter. Chop again. Add more ginger, coriander, green chilies, and cream.

ADDRESS: Taxali Gate Rd, Shahi Mohallah Walled City of Lahore, Lahore, Punjab 54000, Pakistan
OPENING TIME: 4PM - 3:30AM

üáµüá∞ SPICY CHICKEN: Grill the chicken on a tawa. Pour in masala made using white pepper, black pepper, yogurt, ginger & saffron. Add cooking oil and chilies. Serve with chapati. 

üí∏PRICE: PKR 500 - $2.68 USD /per piece
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. ILYAS DUMBA KARAHI - TRUCK ADA
ADDRESS: G.T. Road, near fruite Mandi, bati chowk Qila Lachman Singh, Lahore, Punjab, Pakistan
OPENING TIMES: 5PM - 3AM

üáµüá∞ MUTTON KARAHI: Chop the meat into small pieces. Add meat in Karahi. Add salt over it.
After 30 minutes, add the green chili, ginger, and tomatoes. Add 1 liter of water to make the meat soft. Cover the Karahi and cook for 15 minutes, then add black pepper.

üáµüá∞ LIVER IN CAUL FAT: Wrap the liver in the caul fat and place it in the freezer. Skewer them and grill on charcoal for 15-20 minutes, and then add salt.

üí∏PRICE: Mutton - PKR 2,300 - $12.35USD per kg | Liver - PKR 500 - $2.64 per skewer
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. SIDDIQUE MACHLI FAROSH
ADDRESS: 86 Allama Iqbal Rd, Garhi Shahu, Lahore, Punjab 54000, Pakistan
OPENING TIMES: 12PM - 2AM

üáµüá∞ DEEP-FRIED ROHU FISH (ROHO LABEO) ASIAN FRESH FISH: Marinate the fish with garlic, ginger, carom seed, cumin, ground chili, and salt. Leave to marinate for 2 hours. Serve with BBQ sauce, chapati, and tamarind sauce. 

üí∏PRICE: PKR 1280 - $6.87 USD per kg
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. KHALIFA BALOCHI SAJI
ADDRESS: Main Bazar Gari Shahu, Lahore, Pakistan
OPENING TIME: 5PM - 2AM

üáµüá∞ GRILLED CHICKEN SAJI: Marinate chicken for 24 hours in vinegar and khalifa special spice (green chili, ginger, garlic and whole spice). Grill the chicken for 45 minutes. Serve in a clay pot with special Khalifa Saji Rice.

üáµüá∞ MINCED BEEF KEBAB: Mince beef and mix with oil, onion, ginger, condense milk, garlic, green chili. Grill the kebab for 8-12 minutes over the charcoal.

1. PISTA HOUSE BEST HALEEM BAKERY RESTAURANT
ADDRESS: Shop No.9, 4-77/3/A, Complex, Yousuf Tekri, Toli Chowki, Hyderabad, Telangana 500028

üáÆüá≥MUTTON HALEEM: Boil mutton in mineral water along with green chilies for 5 hours.
Add a mixture of ginger-garlic paste, coriander, and soaked basmati rice. Cook for 15 - 20 minutes. Mix coarse wheat flour with water and pound for about 30 minutes. Add masala to the semi-cooked flour including black peppercorn, khwab chini, cinnamon, cardamom, 2 types of cumin, rose petals, almonds, cloves, big crystal salt and oil. Close and cook. Reduce the fire and leave it to cook for 2 hours. Pound the mixture for 25 minutes and add a paste made of 3 types of lentils, and ghee and pound it more for 5 minutes. Ready to serve. Top with teera, ghee, and fried onions.

üí∏PRICE: 990 INR / $12.72 USD 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. ABBASI NAAN
ADDRESS: Shop number 22, 8-428, Purani Haveli Rd, Nassir Complex, Chatta Bazar, Darulshifa, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002

üáÆüá≥CHAR KONI NAAN (FOUR CORNERED BREAD): Make the dough by mixing all-purpose flour, water, salt, ghee, and yeast together and allowing it to rest for 15 minutes. Roll and flatten the ready dough and cut it into square shapes. Rest these squares for 30 minutes. Wet bread with jaggery water and bake in the tandoor for about 5 minutes.

üí∏PRICE: 15 INR / $0.19 USD for 1 piece
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. SHAH GHOUSE CAFE & RESTAURANT
ADDRESS: 9CWG+F2C, Tolichowki Rd, Near RTA Office, Kakatiya Nagar, Toli Chowki, Hyderabad, Telangana 500008

üáÆüá≥HYDERBADI MUTTON BIRYANI
üí∏PRICE: 620 INR / $7.97 USD for family pack
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. ALMOND HOUSE
ADDRESS: 490, JNTU - Hitech City Road, K P H B Phase 3, Kukatpally, Hyderabad, Telangana 500072

üáÆüá≥MOTI CHOOR LADOO: In a pot full of water, add cardamom powder, food coloring, and sugar. Add fried gram flour that was fried in pure ghee. Cook it till it absorbs the sugar syrup. Cool it off for 5-10 minutes. Add mixture to t5he ladoo-making machine. 

üáÆüá≥ KAJU HONEY ROLL: Cook cashew paste, cardamom powder, and sugar together. Roll dough into balls and stuff with a mixture of butterscotch and honey. Dip balls in honey and coat in shredded almonds and roll.  

üáÆüá≥ MALI GHEWAR: Make batter with all-purpose flour, ghee & water. Pour batter in ghewar round molds and pour ghee on top. Dunk in sugar syrup. Top with rabri (condensed milk), silver foil, splashed with saffron water, whole saffron, and chopped nuts. Ready to eat.

üí∏PRICE: LADOO - 73 INR/ $0.93 USD | KAJU HONEY ROLL -  176 INR/ $2.26 USD | MALI GHEWAR - 85 INR/ $1.09 USD

For the toppings- layer with almonds, cashews, pistachio, diluted saffron water, and add more lassi, cream of the curd, more toppings like almonds, cashews, pistachios and more saffron water.

üáÆüá≥SILVER PAN: On a betel leaf (pan leaf), add katha, kesar chunna , supari (dried areca nut), zarda (Indian chewing tobacco flavored with spices), raisins & nuts mix, gulkand (rose petals cooked in sugar), tutti frutti green colour, khus chutney (green colored poppy seeds sweet chutney), tutti frutti red colour, sweet masala, wrap it up, coat it with silver sheet. üáÆüá≥BAATI CHOKHA: Roast eggplant/brinjal and tomato over direct fire & combine with boiled potato, green chili, coriander, ginger, mustard oil, and dry masalas. Cook for about 30min. | Filling: Wash chickpeas and sundry. Dry roast the chickpea and grind it into powder. Combine the powder with raw mustard oil, carom seeds, red peppercorns, and red chili pickle. Cook for 10 minutes.| BAATI: Roll the wheat dough and fill it with the chickpea stuffing, shape it into a ball. Add these balls over the burned cow dung ashes for cooking for about 10 min. BOBUR PARK

üá∫üáø SUMALAK: Place seeds on a 1m2 table, it takes 3-4 days for the seed to sprout. Water 4 times per day. Cut or break the carpet of wheat into smaller pieces and place it into a bowl. Grind the wheat sprout into a machine. Pour  water in the bowl of the grinded wheat and leave it for 15-20 minutes. Use a cheesecloth to squeeze the juices out. Place mud around the khazan to keep the heat and start the fire. Pour cotton seed oil in the Khazan and put in some river stones. Pour the juices through a sift to make it smoother. Sift the wheat flour then add it into the wheat juice and cook for 10-12h hours. After 10 hours of cooking, put out the fire and cover with cloth.

snippet.description:

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
1. SOMSA MARKAZI
ADDRESS: Kosa Somsa, Namangan

üá∫üáø BEEF SAUSAGE SOMSA: Make the dough overnight. Roll the dough thinly into a round shape with a rolling pin. Mix the chopped beef with onions and season with the chef's secret spice blend (Cumin, parsley, salt, pepper, chili etc). Add cooked cow tongue and beef sausage. Add filling in dough and place on the tandoor wall for 40 minutes. 

üá∫üáø  HORSE SAUSAGE SOMSA: Follow the first steps above. Add horse meat sausage and add lamb sausage. Add filling in dough and place on the tandoor wall for 40 minutes. 

üá∫üáø BOWL SOMSA: Follow the first steps above. Add the lamb skirt. Place filling in the bowl then cover it with the dough sheet. Place it on the tandoor wall for 40 minutes. After it‚Äôs cooked, take it out, cut the lid and add bone marrow soup to the bowl.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. PATIR NO 13 

üá∫üáø BUTTER FLATBREAD: Roll and knead the dough until it‚Äôs flat. Place butter on the top of the bread. Bake on the wall of the oven for 15 minutes.

3. ANHOR 
ADDRESS: Baligehi, Andijon

üá∫üáø CATFISH: Slice the belly in half and clean. Hang the fish for 5 minutes then chop the fish into small pieces. Season the fish with salt. Score the head and add salt. Cook. 

üá∫üáø CATFISH KEBAB: Place the fish on the skewers. Grill it for 15 minutes. Season the fish with the spice blend (salt, paprika, parsley, pepper). 

üá∫üáø  CATFISH STEW: Deep-fry the fish cuts for 5 minutes and the head for 10 minutes. In another Khazan, add butter and then deep-fried fish. 1. DEHQON BOZORI
ADDRESS: Ulitsa Usmona Yusupova, Fergana, Uzbekistan
OPENING TIMES: 6AM - 8PM

üá∫üáø BREAD
üí∏PRICE: 3.00 USD for 3.5kg 

üá∫üáø SHEEP STOMACH PICKLE: Sheep stomach, carrots, cucumbers, bell peppers, Korean chili & salt.
üí∏PRICE: $5.00 USD p/kg
üá∫üáø SAMOSAS: Mince mutton, dough & potatoes.
üí∏PRICE: 3000 soms / $2.50 USD 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
üá∫üáø STIR-FRIED ORGANS: Cut Dumba and slice kidney, heart and liver. Fry the dumba to render the fat. In the same pot, fry lung, meat heart, heart and kidney. Add salt then the testicles. Season with cumin seeds and cover for 10-15 min, then add water. Garnish with red onions, salad and basil. 

üá∫üáø RAW DUMBA SASHIMI: Serve raw dumba with chili salt. 

üá∫üáø SHEEP TESTICLES KEBAB: Chop the testicles and season with chili salt. Let it marinate. Place the testicles on the juniper wood skewers. Grill them for 15 minutes. 

üá∫üáø LIVER & WALNUT WRAPPED IN CAUL FAT: Spread the caul fat, cut into smaller squares. Cut the liver in half. Add chili salt on the caul fat and on the liver. Wrap the liver in caul fat. Chop the walnuts. Stuff the walnuts between the liver and grill it for 20 minutes. 

üá∫üáø QUAIL EGGS WRAPPED IN CAUL FAT: Add salt on the caul fat. Wrap the quail egg with shell with the caul fat. Place wrapped eggs in foil and hgrill it for 15 minutes.

üá∫üáø PUMPKIN DISH: Cut the sheep neck, front legs, ribs into fine pieces. Chop the ribs in half.
Cut the pumpkin open and remove the seeds. Add homemade butter and honey in the pumpkin
Boil the potatoes for 10 minutes. Deep fry the meat for 10 minutes. Place the pumpkin in the middle of the kazan, then add cooked potatoes, water and cover it up. Let it cook for 1.5 hours.
Take the pumpkin out and cook for another 1 hour. Garnish with quail eggs, leeks and parsley.

ADDRESS: Asaka, Uzbekistan
üá∫üáøSHEEP NECK STEW: Cut, trim and chop the sheep neck into pieces. Use chef‚Äôs special blend called 11 spices which includes cumin, paprika, coriander and other herbs. Put meat in the pot, add one layer meat, one layer seasoning, salt and then repeat.

ADDRESS: Andijan, Uzbekistan
INSTAGRAM: @tandirkabob
ü´Å LUNG FILLED WITH MILK: Wash the lungs. Make the dough by mixing together water & flour, then let it rest for 30 minutes. Cut & Slice the onions. Add the milk in a huge bowl/basin, add more milk then add hot water. Add sliced onions and salt into the dough and knead for 20 minutes. Squeeze the dough and filter it into another bowl. Strain the milk again. Add a cube of carrot in the lung. Pour the milk into the lung and add pepper and oil. Secure it with a carrot and a string. Place the lungs in a pot and let it boil for 3 hours. Slice the boiled lungs and sprinkle with some chili salt.
üí∏PRICE: 60,000 so ªms / $5.22 USD per kg

snippet.title: What the Chaga Tribe Eats in a Day!! EXTREME African Food in Tanzania!!
snippet.description:
üé• SECOND CHANNEL!! MORE BEFRS ¬ª http://bit.ly/MoreBEFRS 
üëï BEFRS MERCH ¬ª https://bit.ly/ShopBEFRS
üíó SUPPORT OUR MISSION ¬ª http://bit.ly/BestEverPatreon

Like our music? Enjoy a free 30-day of Epidemic Sound for the best royalty-free music: http://share.epidemicsound.com/BEFRS 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
1. CHAGGA VILLAGE
ADDRESS: Tanzania 

üáπüáø MTORI (BANANA SOUP): Peel and slice unripened bananas and yams. In a pot, boil beef then pour out the beef stock. In the same pot, add bananas, boiled beef, and yams. Add salt and water. Cover with banana leaves, then cover with a small pot to allow it to steam. Let it sit for 30 minutes. Add water and oil and allow it to steam more. Mash everything together. Pour in warmed beef stock and continue mixing and mashing to make it softer.

üáπüáø ROASTED GOAT: In a pot, add salt and the goat's neck and blood. Remove innards. Skewer it and place it on a roasting spit, rotating it every 20 minutes. After about an hour, rub lemon and salt on the goat. Continue roasting for about 2 more hours.

üáπüáø MACHALARI (GOAT INTESTINES): In a large pot, add all of the organs and intestines (whole) and water. Place the pot on the fire and allow it to boil. Add bananas. 

üáπüáø GOAT LIVER: Skewer the liver and place it on the fire. Let it cook for about 15 minutes.
Wrap it in cahl fat. Place it back on the fire for 10 more minutes.

üáπüáø BLOOD & CLEAR SOUP: In a pot, boil all of the innards. In a bowl, add half a cup of raw blood. Add 3-4 ladles of white soup and mix. Add some goat tripe. 

üáπüáø KITOLOLO: Clean the greens and slice them thinly into a bowl. In a separate bowl, slice banana thin. In a separate bowl, crack and peel kweme (oyster nut) the grate it. In a pot, add leaves, banana, nuts, and more leaves. Add soda ash mixed with water. Place on fire. After 30 minutes, add sour milk (fermented for 2-3 days) then mash. Banana beer: mix cooked banana and after 3 days of fermenting, mix with millet powder and let it sit for a few hours then enjoy!

snippet.description:

1. ZIGUA TRIBE

üáπüáø CALF INTESTINES: Clean and braid the intestines. Combine with the tripe. In a big pot, add the intestines and cook for 10 minutes. Add salt, water and lime.

üáπüáø LIVER: Clean and chop liver. In a small pot, add liver. Add salt and ginger. Stir. Hang the meat overnight. 

üáπüáø BBQ MEAT: Cover meat with salt. Cut a slits in the legs. Add ginger, garlic and lime juice. Rub sauce on meat. 

üáπüáø MANDAZI: Pour in wheat flour and add sugar. Mix. Add sunflower oil and mix. Add yeast and mix. Add warm water and mix. Knead into a ball. Roll out and cut into shapes. In a wok, add sunflower oil and fry. 

üáπüáø TEA: Boil water, add tea grass, ginger and sugar.

üáπüáø RICE CAKE: In a bowl, pour rice flour, wheat flour and corn porridge. Add sugar, yeast and warm water and mix.


üáπüáø PORRIGE: In a wood vessel, add soaked corn and pound into corn powder. Sieve. In a pot, add water and corn powder. Cook for about 20 minutes. Add salt and continue stirring.

üáπüáø PILAU: In a pot, add chopped beef and cook. In a separate pot, add oil, red onion, mix. Add ground ginger and garlic mix. Add ground spices (cardamom, cinnamon, and cumin). Add meat and mix. Add salt. Add water

Like our music? Enjoy a free 30-day of Epidemic Sound for the best royalty-free music: http://share.epidemicsound.com/BEFRS 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
1. KIVUKONI FISH MARKET
ADDRESS: Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania

üáπüáøFRIED TUNA: Cut the tuna into steaks and clean. Grate ginger over the tuna steaks, patting it down. Add salt. Fry for 7-10 minutes. 

üáπüáøSARDINE SOUP: Slice tomatoes into with sliced onions. Place pot on fire. Add salt and mix. Peel and slice green mango. Add water and green pepperoncini. 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. ON POINT KITCHENS
INSTAGRAM: @onpointkitchenstz

üáπüáøFIRIGISI CHANGIMOTO: Mix together blended garlic, soy sauce, meat tenderizer and lime. In a big frying pan, add oil then add gizzards. Fry for 10-15 minutes then place in a bowl. In a new pan, add water, soy sauce, red onions and mix. Add vinegar and gizzards. 

üáπüáøCHIPS MAYAI AKA ZEGE: Mix together green peppers, carrots and onions. In a small bowl, add eggs and salt. In a small omelet pan, add oil then french fries and top with veggie mix. Place on a charcoal grill. Pour an egg on top and allow it to cook. 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. COCO BEACH 

üáπüáøMASHED POTATO IN COCONUT: Hollow out coconut. Add coconut cream, mashed potato and mishikaki. Remove wood skewers | Coconut cream: mix chili powder, lemon, salt, and coconut cream.

üáπüáøUROJO: In a bowl, add a hard-boiled egg, spinach, pakora, kachori, and cassava crisps. Pour soup on top | Soup: wheat flour mixed with mango juice and salt and lime.

üáπüáøBEEF MSHIKAKA: Skewer beef and grill. Mash some cassava and sprinkle salt on top. Add red juice (tomato sauce) and yellow juice (carrot, green chili, ginger and garlic and onion).

üá™üá¨COW HEAD: In a big pot called Hala, add Sausage, liver and green chili. Fry. Add into Egyptian bread with onions and serve with tahini and salsa. 

üá™üá¨RICE PUDDING: Add rice, water, milk, sugar and mix it. Add some drops of vanilla. Cook it until it has a porridge texture. 
üí∏PRICE: From 10.00 EGP / 0.64 USD 

üá™üá¨SHEEP HEAD: Chop the boiled sheep head and place on a plate. Serve with boiled sheep head broth and tomatoes, onions & green chili salsa﻿.

2. NEFA EL NAGAHY
ADDRESS: 24 El Menagedin St. Off El Fahhamin St., Azhar, Cairo

üá™üá¨SHEEP PLATTER: Place pieces of meat (shoulder, neck, ribs but they are melted, sausage, tail, sheep testicles and liver﻿) on a plate and add parsley - serve with grounded tahini & pickled vegetables

üá™üá¨EGYPTIAN WHISKEY: Salad water with pepper. The salad water is made from tomatoes, onions & green peppers.

ADDRESS: 128 Al Azhar, El-Darb El-Ahmar, El Gamaliya, Cairo Governorate, Egypt

üá™üá¨STUFFED PIGEON: Stuff pigeon with rice, then season with cumin, onion, salt and pepper. Simmer the pigeon until tender. Roll the pigeon in spices and sear it in a pan until caramelized. 
üí∏PRICE: 80.00 EGP / 5.09 USD

üí∏PRICE: 100.00 EGP / 6.36 USD

1. MPISI VILLAGE
ADDRESS: Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe

üáøüáº BREAD: Mix together cornmeal, sorghum and water. Place it on the side of the pot with water in the bottom of the pot to steam. Let it cook for 30 minutes. Serve with tea/ boiling water.

üáøüáº GOAT BLOOD: In a pot, add blood, fat, lungs, some liver and bile. Mix and cook for an hour. Add salt to add taste.

üáøüáº GOAT LIVER: Cook liver in a pot for one hour then grill and serve. Add salt to add taste.

üáøüáº INTESTINES AND TRIPE: Clean intestines. Boil the intestines for 1hour 3minutes. Add salt. 

üáøüáº RABBIT: Chop rabbit in half. Remove innards. Lay on braai, add salt and close clamp. Lay on fire for 45 minutes.

1. VINCENT‚ÄôS HOUSE
ADDRESS: Deka Drum Village 

üáøüáº ZIMBABWEAN BREAD: In a bowl, mix maize meal, flour, salt, sugar, and water.
On coals, place a pot. In the pot add flour. Then pour in the mixture above. Cover with a plate and put coal on top. Let cook for 20 min.

üáøüáº PORRIDGE: In a pot, add Sinka then pour in hot water and cover. Then place it on fire. Remove the sica and bring water to a boil. Once boiling, pour in a maize meal. Add sugar and mix. 

üáøüáº FRIED TILAPIA: In a pot, add flour. Separately, filet the Tilapia. Add salt. Roll in flour. Then place it in a pot with oil. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg. Remove fish and then roll in egg yolk. Place back in the pot to lightly fry.

üáøüáº DRIED TILAPIA:  Scale, filet, lay the fish on a rack. Dry it over a fire for 4 hours and place it in the sun every day.  

üáøüáº FRIED GUINEA FOWL: Bowl the guinea fowl and de-feather. Cut into pieces. Roll in flour and fry with a little oil. 

üáøüáº STEAMED TILAPIA: Scale the tilapia and cut it in half. Add to a pot, with salt and a little water. Boil. Add tomato seasoning and boil a bit more. Plate with sadza.

1. MBARE MARKET
ADDRESS: Harare, Zimbabwe

üáøüáº COW LUNGS WITH RICE & PUMPKIN LEAVES: Boil the cow lungs in water and add salt, onions, and tomatoes. Boil rice in water with salt. Boil pumpkin leaves in water and add bicarbonate of soda. Drain the water and fry the leaves in oil.

üáøüáºTERMITES & RED ANTS

üí∏PRICE: Cow Lungs - $2.00 USD | Termites & Red Ants - $2.00 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. ARETHA‚ÄôS HOUSE
ADDRESS: 121 Vito St Mbare, Harare

üáøüáºANTS WITH PEANUT BUTTER: Fry ants for 10 minutes. Add peanut butter and 1 cup of water and stir. Add shallots and a pinch of salt to taste. Serve with sadza.

üáøüáºCOW HEAD: Clean the cow head and remove the brain. Chop into edible sizes then remove all small bones then remove the tongue. Place pieces of meat into a big pot with salt and cook for about 4 hours. Serve with sadza and rape or kovo. 

üáøüáºCOW TONGUE: Boil the tongue for 30 minutes until soft. Remove from the fire, put aside and peel off the outer skin. Place the tongue on a braai stand and grill until its ready to eat﻿.

1. BIGMAN BRAAI 
ADDRESS: Zindoga shopping centre, A4, Harare, Zimbabwe
INTERVIEWEE: CHIPO 

üáøüáºGANGO: In a wok, add ox kidney and beef then water and salt. In a separate bowl, clean chicken gizzards then chop. Add to the wok. Allow it to cook for 10 minutes. 
Separately, Cut chicken parts and add to the wok. Add water. Stir and allow to cook. Add heart, pork belly and spicy pork sausage. Add cooking oil. Add onions and tomatoes and mix. Add rape, kovo and chilies. Serve with sadza. 

üí∏PRICE: $11.00 USD 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. ADDRESS: Zindoga shopping centre, A4, Harare, Zimbabwe

üáøüáºBEEF BONES & PEANUT BUTTER RICE: Boil beef bones in a big pot for 2 hours until they start to fall off the bone. Add salt and tomatoes boil for another hour.

üí∏PRICE: $1.00 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. ADDRESS: Zindoga shopping centre, A4, Harare, Zimbabwe

üáøüáºFRIED CHICKEN: Marinate the chicken using Madras Curry Powder and mixed chicken spice. Take a full chicken and lightly grill on both sides. In a pot, add olive oil. Chop the grilled chicken and place in the pot with oil to fry.

üí∏PRICE: $3.00 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. MEREKI IN WARREN PARK
ADDRESS: Crowbohough Road, Warren Park D, Harare, Zimbabwe

üáøüáºPIG TESTICLES: Cut pig testicles and season with salt then place on the gas braai stand to cook.

üáøüáºGOTCHIE GOTCHIE: BBQ for 30 minutes, adding salt. Serve with cucumbers, tomatoes and onions.

ADDRESS: Zimbabwe
INTERVIEWEE: Gracia Bvute

üáøüáºFRIED GOAT BLOOD: Pour goat blood and fat in a pot over fire with oil. Add salt and mix for about 20 minutes. 

üáøüáºSORGHUM: Mix the sorghum powder/flour into a porridge and let it boil for roughly 15 minutes. Add more sorghum meal/ flour to the porridge while mixing vigorously to form a thick dough over high heat and then leave it to simmer for 15 minutes over the low heat. 

üáøüáºCOW INTESTINES & TRIPE: In a pot, add boiled parts and oil. Add chopped onions. Mix.

üáøüáºCOW LEGS: Chop and boil the legs,  then add to a pot with cooking oil. Add tomatoes and onions. Pour in the water the legs were boiled in. Add seasonings, honey and lime juice. 

üáøüáºCOW TONGUE: Boil then peel the skin. Chop into chunks and boil again. Add to the pot with oil, tomatoes and onion. ﻿

snippet.title: Indian-Jamaican Meltdown in Montego Bay!! Goat Will Never Be The Same!!
snippet.description:
üé• SECOND CHANNEL!! MORE BEFRS ¬ª http://bit.ly/2pQYjvM​
üëï BEFRS MERCH ¬ª https://bit.ly/ShopBEFRS
üíó SUPPORT OUR MISSION ¬ª http://bit.ly/BestEverPatreon
 üìπ FOLLOW MATTHEW ¬ª IG: @jamaicafoodboss﻿ | YT: https://bit.ly/JMFoodBoss 

Like our music? Enjoy a free 30-day of Epidemic Sound for the best royalty free music: http://share.epidemicsound.com/BEFRS 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
1. MONTEGO BAY RIVER GARDENS
ADDRESS: Montego Bay 
INTERVIEWEE: Rajah 

üáØüá≤ DAAL & SALTFISH CHOKKA: Soak the Saltfish for an hour. Place it directly on top of the fire. Flip it on both sides. Place in a dish with water to soak for a bit. Take the pieces out and scrape the skin off, then break them in tiny pieces. In a pot, saut√© onions, garlic, scotch bonnet peppers and scallions. Add to a big bowl with Saltfish. | Daal: in a pot, boil the lentils in a pot with water. Add curry and garlic. Stir then allow it to simmer down. When water has reduced, mix a bit more. Saut√©/burn garlic in a hot pan and then add the saut√©ed/burned garlic to the daal.

üáØüá≤ ROASTED TESTICLES: Clean and cut the testicles and a half. Add pepper and jerk seasoning. Add directly on top of fire. Flip after a few minutes.

üáØüá≤ SAUTEED GOAT BRAIN: Place a pot over the fire and add oil. Add goat Brain. Add salt and pepper. Add onions. Mix.

üáØüá≤ MANNISH WATER: Place the goat head directly on fire to burn the hair away. Scrape the burnt parts off. Wash the head. Chop the goat head in half and then into smaller pieces. Place the intestines in a pot of boiling water with garlic. After boiling, clean and slice them into small pieces. Boil water then add onions, scallions, scotch bonnet peppers, thyme and garlic. Add seasoning powder then chopped head and intestines. Add sliced pumpkin. Chop up yam, potatoes, carrots. Allow to cook. 

üáØüá≤ CURRY GOAT: Slaughter and slice the goat to allow it to drain. Remove intestines and inner organs and set aside. Cut up the goat into smaller pieces and wash. Season with all-purpose seasoning and mix. Cut up onions, scallions, garlic and Scotch bonnet peppers. Burn curry in a big pot. Add onions, garlic, scallions and scotch bonnet peppers and saut√©. Add chopped up goat meat. Mix. Allow it to cook.

Thanks to Deja Resort for helping to make this episode possible! Book your stay with them here: http://www.dejaresort.com/

2. BOBO HILL RASTA VILLAGE
ADDRESS: BULL BAY, ST. THOMAS
INTERVIEWEES: Priest Prince & Chef Jah Wordy 

üáØüá≤ BOILED VEGETABLES (GROUND PROVISIONS) & DUMPLINGS:  Dumplings: Mix together whole wheat flour, cornmeal and sea salt. Knead and leave it to rise. Soak the green bananas, dasheen and coco to ensure it softens a bit before placing it in the fire. It soaks for 30 minutes.
Place a pot on the fire with water. Add sea salt. Cut the skin off the green banana and cut the dasheen and cocos. Add the cut vegetables to the pot then add the green bananas last.

üáØüá≤ CONGO ITAL STEW: Boil the gungo peas in a pot with water and sea salt. Add coconut milk to the pot. Chop up carrots, okra and Irish potato and add in the pot on the fire. Stir. Allow it to boil a bit, then add more coconut milk.

üáØüá≤ STEAMED VEGETABLES WITH ACKEE: Clean and wash the ackee and leave it to soak for 5 minutes. In a bowl, Cut the callaloo, cabbage, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, peppers & scallion.
Boil the ackee in a separate pot with water and sea salt. In another pot, pour coconut milk in the pot. Allow it to simmer for 15 minutes. Add the vegetables & coconut oil. Cover the pot and allow it to steam for 10-15 minutes. Add salt and stir. Add the boiled Ackee.

üáØüá≤ COW SKIN & CHICKEN FOOT SOUP: Pour water in a pot. Add jerk seasoning, seasoning salt, scallions, thyme, scotch bonnet peppers and margarine. Add yam, dasheen, coco, carrots, cow skin and chicken foot, sweet potatoes, red peas and pumpkin. Allow it to boil and simmer for 30 minutes. 

üáØüá≤ BOILED CRAB WITH COCONUT & BOILED CORN: Wash the crabs and place in boiling water. Add jerk seasoning, seasoning salt, scallions, thyme, scotch bonnet peppers and margarine. Allow it to boil for 25 minutes. | Coconut: Break coconut into pieces then place in water. | Boiled corn: Place corn on the cobs in a pot with water. Add scallion, peppers and seasoning salt.

ADDRESS: Across from Heroes Circle, Kingston, Jamaica 

üáØüá≤ ROAST YAM & SALTFISH: Soak the Saltfish and drain it. Place the yam on the grill for 30-40 minutes. Add Saltfish to the same grill for 15-20 minutes. In a pot, place tomatoes, scotch bonnet peppers, cucumbers, onions and thyme in and put it to boil. Add pieces of roasted fish. Assemble yam and sauce together. 

PRICE: $800 JMD / $5.19 USD

üáØüá≤ ACKEE & SALTFISH WITH FRIED DUMPLING: Clean ackee. Place the ackee in a pot of salted water to boil for 5-10 minutes. Cut up tomatoes, onions, scotch bonnet peppers and scallion. Place a pan on the fire with oil. Add the seasonings then the saltfish. Add ackee & black pepper. | Fried dumpling: Knead flour, salt, lasco milk powder and baking powder. Place a pot on the fire with oil. Take a piece of the dough and roll it into a ball in your hands. Drop it in the pot to fry.

Add jerk seasoning & browning sauce. Add the seasoned meat in a pot with oil and stir. Add water. Place the lid on the fire for it to pressure for 15 minutes. Add beans and flavor with spices.

1. MT. PLEASANT FISHING VILLAGE
ADDRESS: Cargill Creek, Andros
INTERVIEWEE: Solomon Murphy
üáßüá∏BARRACUDA: Clea, fillet and remove the veins from the barracuda. Fry in hot oil and serve hot.
PRICE: $20.00 USD  
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. MT. PLEASANT FISHING VILLAGE
ADDRESS: Cargill Creek, Andros
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Emerson
üáßüá∏WILD BOAR: Bring the herbs, spices and the vegetables to a boil in a medium-sized saucepan and cook for about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature. Strain, reserving the bay leaf, thyme, peppercorns and cloves, and discarding the vegetables. Pat meat dry and place it in a shallow dish. Pour the cooled marinade over it, return it to the refrigerator, loosely covered, and let it marinate. Remove the wild boar from the marinade and pat it dry. Make 20 tiny slits in it all over, and insert a clove into each slit. Transfer the boar to a baking dish, and pour one-fourth of the marinade over it. Roast until the boar is very golden on the outside.
üáßüá∏WILD BOAR SOUP - Make with onions, carrots and irish potatoes, boiled in a homemade broth of water and seasonings, salt, pepper, lime, bay leaf.
üáßüá∏SAUTEED LIVER - Make with carrots, liver, peppercorns, vinegar, onions, sweet pepper, garlic and oil.
PRICE: $300.00 USD per boar

INTERVIEWEE: Chef Kishley
üáßüá∏STEW FISH: Brown the fish then combine it with flour which has been browned in oil, onions, spices, carrots, potatoes, and tomato paste. Simmer until the fish is tender and fully cooked. Serve this stew with homemade bread or johnny cakes on the side.
PRICE: $18.00 USD  
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. LUCKY LUSCA
ADDRESS: Staniard Creek, Andros
INTERVIEWEE: Charlene
üáßüá∏ STUFFED PIGEON: Stuff each pigeon's cavity and under the skin. Place the stuffed pigeons in the stock for 15 minutes to cook.Pull the pigeons out of the stock and let them rest.
üí∏PRICE: $40.00 USD per pigeon
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. MT.PLEASANT FISHING LODGE, CHEF LAURIE‚ÄôS RESIDENCE
ADDRESS: Cargill Creek, Andros
INTERVIEWEE: Laurie
üáßüá∏ CRAB N DOUGH: Break the legs and remove them from the crab‚Äôs body
In a pot, add crabs then place dough. Combine flour, baking powder and salt, mixed with water. Make a firm dough. knead well and allow to rest 10 minutes. In a large pot, add a cup of water seasoned with salt, add pepper, and bring to a boil. Flatten dough and place over the crab. Cover the pot, boil on medium heat for 20 ‚Äì 25 minutes without opening the pot.

1. HAITIAN GROCERY STORE
ADDRESS: Nassau, New Providence
INTERVIEWEE: Sherlanda Baptiste

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. CARIBBEAN CUISINE
ADDRESS: Finlayson Street, New Providence
INTERVIEWEE: Sherlanda Baptiste & Jeannine Belias

üáßüá∏ üá≠üáπPATAE: Cut the dough into a square-like shape and stuff it with mackerel. Pinch together to form a dumpling. Fry and enjoy with pepper sauce.

üáßüá∏ üá≠üáπHAITIAN LEGUME: Cut the rib / oxtail / cow feet. Separately, chop carrots, onions and celery. Add legumes. In a big pot, add meat. In a separate bowl, add seasonings and fresh squeezed lime. Mix and pour into the pot with the meat. Add vegetables and boil down for a few hours. Separately, peel papayas, eggplants and cabbage and place in a pot to boil. Let them cool and then mash them using a mallet. Mix everything together and serve with rice.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. DO-DOON‚ÄôS KITCHEN
ADDRESS: Arawak Cay (Junkanoo Village), Nassau, New Providence
INTERVIEWEE: Asline and Sharmaine

üáßüá∏ üá≠üáπPORK PLANTAIN BOWL: ÔªøPeel a green plantain. Cut in two or three horizontally  then fry for 10 minutes. Mold the plantains in the shape of a bowl. Fry once more for 5-10 minutes.| Pork: Boil large chunks of pork then lightly fry the pork. Chop the pork into small pieces. | Pikliz: Mix together shredded cabbage, thinly sliced scotch bonnet pepper, sliced onions and carrots, salt and peppercorns. Take the plantain bowl and fill it with chopped pork. Top it with pikliz and a sprinkle of fresh parsley

üáßüá∏ üá≠üáπPORK GRIOT: In a large pot, cook seasoned pork for about 45 minutes. Once cooked, broil meat for about 5 to 10 minutes. Fry until brown. Place pork in a bowl with cooked green plantains. ÔªøPlace the pork on the serving dish and top with sliced peppers, onions and fresh parsley. Serve with fried plantain chips and pikliz. 

üí∏PRICE: Pork Plantain Bowl - $8 | Pork Griot - $12 USD

1. MONTAGU BEACH + ÔªøMONTAGU BEACH FISH MARKET
ADDRESS: Montagu Beach
INTERVIEWEE: Tomicko Mackey (Micko)

üêöRAW CONCH: Crack the conch shell & gently pull the conch out. Skin the conch and remove the inedible parts. Score the conch. Squirt with fresh lime and enjoy!
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. YELLOW & BOBBY‚ÄôS STALL
ADDRESS: Montagu Beach
INTERVIEWEE: Yellow
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. DINO‚ÄôS GOURMET CONCH SALAD
ADDRESS: 849 West Bay Street Gambier Village, Nassau
INTERVIEWEE: Dino Higgs
WEBSITE: https://dinos-gourmet-conch-salad.business.site/ 

üêöTRADITIONAL CONCH SALAD: Remove the conch from the shell and de-skin. Clean it in salt water
then clean it with lime. Mince onions, green pepper and tomato. Slice the conch in half, then into thin, small slices. Add pepper blend, salt & mix. Place in a bowl and add lime juice and an orange on top. Garnish with a lime and orange. Top with the conch red.

üêöTRADITIONAL CONCH SALAD + OLD FASHIONED SCORCH CONCH SALAD: In a bowl, add chopped pineapple, green peppers, onions, tomatoes and a mango. Add salt and goat pepper to the bowl and then scoop mixture into a pineapple. Take a new conch and scorch it. Rub the scorch conch with pepper and rub with salt and place the scorched conch on top. Add sliced mango. 

üí∏PRICE: First dish - $12 | Second dish - $25 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. THE CAPTAIN‚ÄôS TABLE 
ADDRESS: Marina in Lyford Cay, Wester New Providence
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Leonardis

üêöCONCH FRITTERS: In a food processor,chop onions & tomatoes. Pour mixture into a mixing bowl. Remove the buds from the conch then place raw conch into the food processor. Add lime juice, thyme, salt, pepper, flour and baking soda. Roll into balls & fry until golden brown. | Caliper sauce: ÔªøMayo, ketchup, hot sauce and lime juice.

üêöCRACKED CONCH: Slice the tender conch into strips. Dip the slices into a mixture of eggs, salt and pepper.Roll in flour & lightly fry until golden brown. Serve with french fries & caliper dipping sauce.

üêöBLACKENED CONCH: Season the tenderized conch with blackened spice. In a pan with oil, sear conch on both sides, then saute julienned vegetables. Dice the conch then add to the vegetable mix. | Sriracha Honey Mayo: 1 tbsp mayo, 1 tbsp sriracha, 1/2 tbsp honey, Salt TT, Pepper TT, Juice of 1/2 lime. In a mixing bowl, whisk all ingredients together. | ÔªøServe with tropical salsa & top with apple tuile.

ADDRESS: Montagu Beach

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. SIP SIP
ADDRESS: Atlantis Resort - Paradise Island
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Kim Burrows
ü¶ûLOBSTER QUESADILLA: Boil dice carrots, onion, and celery. Add lobster and let boil for 10-15 minutes. Once boiled, remove lobster from the pot and place in an ice bath. Remove the lobster meat from the tail, then dice the meat. Separately, mix together grated pepper jack cheese, white cheddar cheese & 3 stems of scallions. Lightly brush olive oil on the outer part of the 10-inch tortilla. Sprinkle ancho chili powder. Add cheese. Add chopped lobster meat and sprinkle a touch of cheese then close. Place on a flat top grill and let cook until golden brown on both sides.Squeeze chipotle Cremer on top and drizzle salsa in the middle. Sprinkle green onions on top.
üí∏PRICE: $45 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. ATLANTIS BEACH
ADDRESS: Atlantis Resort - Paradise Island
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Elrod Munnings
ü¶ûLOBSTER STUFFED BANANA LEAF: Grill the banana leaf on the grill to make it pliable. Place the banana leaf down first, then add the three ounces of the cook grits as the base. Add two ounces of lobster filling on top of the cooked grits. Oil all 4 sides of the banana leaf to help it stick together and fold. Once that is done oil the grill and place the stuff banana leaf on the grill and cook for 6-8 mins. Once complete open the stuff banana leaf and garnish with the mango salsa, micro greens and olive oil.
üí∏PRICE: $18 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. FRANKIE GONE BANANAS
ADDRESS: Atlantis Resort - Paradise Island
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Maxine Smith
‚Äã‚Äãü¶ûLOBSTER TAIL: Blend ingredients (Cilantro, parsley, spring onions, garlic cloves, ginger, lime juice, lemon juice, olive oil, jerk sauce, fresh orange juice, sea salt and pepper) together. Rub evenly on Lobster, place on an open grill to mark. Remove from the char grill and place in an oven at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with salad, sweet potatoes & salad
ü•óJUNKANOO AVOCADO SALAD: Peel and dice mango, pineapple and avocados. Slice purple red orions and heirloom tomatoes. Place all ingredients (including fresh orange juice, lemon juice, small red onion (sliced) & lime juice) in a mixing bowl and toss, season with salt and pepper.
üçåPLANTAIN: Toss plantains with olive oil and roast until golden brown. Take out of the oven and sprinkle on cinnamon and honey.

snippet.title: $1 Tacos VS $113 Tacos in MEXICO!! Super RARE Mexican Food!!
snippet.description:
üé• SECOND CHANNEL!! MORE BEFRS ¬ª http://bit.ly/2pQYjvM‚Äã
üëï BEFRS MERCH ¬ª https://bit.ly/ShopBEFRS

Like our music? Enjoy a free 30-day of Epidemic Sound for the best royalty free music: http://share.epidemicsound.com/BEFRS 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
1. TACOS DON JAIME
Interviewee: Jaime Jasso Gonzales

üåÆTACOS WITH REFRIED BEANS: Make the fillings for the taco using 1/2 kilo of cooked black beans, one cup of chicken broth, 3 spoons of lard, 1/2 of an onion, 1 sprig of epazote and salt. Chop onions. In a pot, sweat the onions and add the beans then the chicken broth. Mix in salt and epazote. Assembly: Layer the tortilla with chicharron grease, then add fillings, close tortilla and then add onions and hot oil on top

üåÆCHICHARRON TACOS: : Layer the tortilla with chicharron grease, then add fillings, close the tortilla and then add onions and hot oil on top.

üåÆPOTATO TACOS: Layer the tortilla with chicharron grease, then add fillings, close the tortilla and then add onions and hot oil on top.

üí∏PRICE: 7 pesos / 0.34 cents per taco
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. MARISCOS LOS PAISAS
ADDRESS: Mercado de Jamaica 
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Daniel Silva 
WEBSITE: https://mariscoselpaisa.negocio.site/ 

üåÆOCTOPUS AL PASTOR: Make Octopus in Al Pastor sauce. Assembly: Start with the top of a pineapple: add octopus. Add a pineapple. Add an octopus. Add pineapple. Add octopus and repeat the process until full. Torch the octopus. Cut tentacles off and place on a flat top grill. Add tortillas. When they get crispy, use the tortilla to scoop the octopus out. Add pineapples. Add onions. Add guacamole and squeeze a lime on top.

üí∏PRICE: $8.50 per plate
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. COLMILLO - MASARYK
ADDRESS: Esquina, Arist√≥teles 124, Polanco, Miguel Hidalgo, 11560 Mexico City, CDMX
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Javier Valenzuela
WEBSITE: https://colmillo.mx/ 

üåÆBLACK BEEF TROMPO: Place onions in the oven to blacken. When blackened, take them out and mash them in a mortar. Set aside lemon pepper, pariente) and seasoning juice. Season the beef with pariente, lemon pepper and the seasoning juice. Add onion ash. Mix it all in. Add more meat on top of the tray and repeat the seasoning process. Add blackened meat to the trompo. Grill for 20 minutes. Add meat to the plate. Serve with cilantro and onions and lime. Sauces: salsa verde and rojo. 

üåÆBABY GOAT CONFIT TACOS:  Take baby goat and chop it into big chunks. In a pot filled with lard, add goat chunks. Cook for 6 hours, then remove the meat and shred. Take the shredded goat meat and add to the grill. Place tortillas down and slather on Peruvian refried beans sauce. Add butter on the grill. Flip until ready. Add avocados on top of tacos. Add on special salsa sauce made using Fresadilla tomato sauce and roasted three-chillies. Prepare garnish with fresadilla tomatoes, olive oil, parsley and assemble on top of tacos.

üåÆBURNT STEAK TACO W/ BONE MARROW: Add asadero cheese on top of the grill. Add corn tortilla. Flip. Add beef fillet and place salt on meat. Add dark sauce and white sauce. Squeeze lime on top. Flip. Add meat on top of the tortilla. Add cilantro. Add fried parsley with tempura. Add piqu√≠n sauce.

üí∏PRICE: $113 USD for all dishes

1. OBRADOR SLAUGHTERHOUSE
ADDRESS: Tulancingo, Hidalgo
Interviewee: Moises Rodriguez Vargas + Norma Vargas 

üá≤üáΩ GRILLED ANT EGGS WITH BUTTER AND TORTILLAS: On a hot grill, add butter. Add onions, epazote and peppers. Add ant eggs on top of ingredients. Add more ant eggs. Flip the ingredients so it cooks evenly. Place the tortilla on the grill to heat up then assemble.

üá≤üáΩ HONEY WATER & PULQUE 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. EL HIDALGUENSE 
ADDRESS: Campeche 155, Roma Sur, Cuauht√©moc, 06760 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, M√©xico
INTERVIEWEE: Moises Rodriguez Vargas 
WEBSITE: https://www.facebook.com/el.hidalguense.5 
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/restauranteelhidalguense/ 

üá≤üáΩ  MIXIOTE: De-skin, slice testacles & add into small pieces and into a bowl. Add diced lamb fat, onions and garlic. Add diced epazote leaves, salt and chillies. Lay down the first thin, clear layer of a maguey leaf. Add mixture & tie with a small piece of rope. Place in an underground pit. Serve with tortillas, onions and lime, green salsa and red salsa.Ôªø

üá≤üáΩ BARBACOA: Clean and butcher the lamb. Place a zinc on the fire and add maguey leaves. Grill the maguey leaves for a bit to make them more flexible. In an underground oven, consomme pot & wooden lattice. Layer some maguey leaves down. Add each chunk of unseasoned meat on top of a piece of maguey leaf. Add the stomach and mixiote dishes at the side. Add maguey leaves on top. Add wooden lattice. Add maguey leaves. Add tarp. Leave in the underground oven for 14 -16 hours. When cooked, pull out the meat piece by piece and immediately add salt. 

üá≤üáΩ MAGUEY WORM SALSA: On a grill, add diced onions, chilies, tomatoes, garlic and maguey worms to roast. Take onions and garlic and place in a volcanic stone mortar, then add tomatoes and maguey worms. Grind everything up. 

üá≤üáΩ CONSOMME: n a big pot, add onions, garlic, epazote, garbanzo beans, rice salt and water. Bring the pot to the underground oven. Place the pot into the oven and then add a small wooden lattice on top.

1. PASTELER√çA MADRID
ADDRESS: 5 de Febrero 25, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico

üá≤üáΩ PAN DE MUERTO: Take baked bread and lather it in syrup that has matured for 6 months, then dip it in icing sugar.

2. MOLES TEOCALLI 
ADDRESS: Miguel Hidalgo 28, Nuchtla, Tula, Milpa Alta, 12200 San Pedro Atocpan, CDMX

3. FAMILY MOLINA
ADDRESS: Milpa Alta 
INTERVIEWEE: Sarah  

MOLE ALMENDRADO: Place banana, chocolate, cookies, almonds, hazelnut, nuts, peanuts, raisins, tortillas, bread, garlic in a big pot. In the grinder machine, grind dried chilies and sesame seeds into the pot with the rest of the ingredients. Take that same pot and place it in the same grinder one more time. After, pour the grinded ingredients into another grinder to make the mixture finer. Second machine has a metal disk that grinds the ingredients. The final machine has a rock inside that simulates how they, the ancestors, used to make mole in the past making the ingredients finer.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
4. LUCIA‚ÄôS & SARAH‚ÄôS FAMILY HOME
ADDRESS: Av. Cuauht√©moc 1371, Santa Cruz Atoyac, 03310, Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX

üá≤üáΩ MOLE WITH ROSEMARY, SHRIMP, CACTUS AND POTATOES: In a pot, add olive oil and then the mole paste, then stir. Add water and stir until it becomes a thick sauce. Add more water. Continue stirring. Add chopped cactus in the pot. Add shrimp. Add potatoes. Add rosemary and stir. Add salt. Leave it for 15 minutes. Add shrimp cakes. serve with rice, tamales and tortillas.Ôªø

üá≤üáΩ CANDIED SWEET POTATO: Soak sweet potatoes in water for hours. Place soaked sweet potatoes with guava, orange, cinnamon, sugar, pineapple and water.

1. ANASTASIA‚ÄôS HOME
ADDRESS: Mlipa Alta 
INTERVIEWEE: Anastasia 

üá≤üáΩ FAVA BEANS, NOPALE AND EPAZOTE SALAD: Slice the cactus in small pieces. Grill the fava beans on the stove. In a pot, add boiled water, Fava beans, salt and epazote stems. When boiling, use a spoon to scoop out the impurities floating at the top. When ready, serve in a bowl and enjoy.
 
üá≤üáΩ NOPALE SOPE WITH BEEF AND CHEESE: Tortilla making - flatten the dough made with nopal dough in the tortilla press then place on the grill to make the tortilla. Make multiple halfway cuts in the cactus. On a hot grill, place the cactus down. Add beef on the grill. Season the beef with salt. Add salt on the cactus. Add more oil. Flip the beef and cactus. Add cheese on beef.

üá≤üáΩ NOPALE WATER: Add chopped cactus to blender, then pineapple, then sugar, then water and blend.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. CARAJILLO 
ADDRESS: Av. Pdte. Masaryk 20, Polanco, Polanco V Secc, Miguel Hidalgo, 11580 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, M√©xico
WEBSITE: http://carajillomx.com/ 
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Arroyo 

üá≤üáΩ GRILLED NOPAL TACO MADE WITH THINLY SLICED RIB EYE, REFRIED BEANS, THIN CHEESE CRUST, CARAMELIZED ONIONS AND ANT EGGS: place olive oil on cactus and sprinkle rock sea salt. Place it on the grill. Flip the cactus until ready. Take a small bowl and cut a circle into the cactus. Add the black beans and mozzarella cheese on top of the cactus. Place it face down on the grill. Add ribeye steak on the grill. Flip continuously until golden brown. Place the cactus down on a chopping board. Add beef on top. Add the ant eggs on the grill. Add the caramelized onions on the grill. Add the grilled ant eggs onto cactus base, then caramelized onions, then a slice of avocado.

üá≤üáΩ CAPRESE SALAD WITH NOPAL: Take the cactuses and cut circles into it. Add lime and squeeze it onto the cactus. Mix it around with your fingers. Cut tomatoes into slices and put it to the side. Shred Oaxacan cheese. Cut another lime and place to the side. Sprinkle salt on tomatoes as well as lime juice. | Plating: place tomato on plate, then cactus, then tomatoes and repeat until plate is full. Add Oaxacan cheese in the center of the plate. Pour a little pesto sauce over the plate. Add pumpkin seeds on top. Add cilantro sprouts and leaves.

üá≤üáΩ CORN BREAD WITH NOPAL JELLY & PRICKLY PEAR ICE CREAM: Dice boiled cactus. In a hot pan, add sugar to caramelize. Add reduction of goat milk with sugar and diced nopales and mix. Add water to ensure it doesn‚Äôt stick to the pan and burn. Mix. Turn off the fire. | Plating: Add cornbread, then Nopale syrup/jelly. Add caramelized popcorn. Add flowers. Add crumbled cookies. ADDRESS: Mercado de San Juan

3. EL MORAL RANCH 
ADDRESS: Tlaxcala, Mexico
INTERVIEWEE: Fernando, Pepe & Ivette Moreno  

üá≤üáΩ WHOLE WILD BOAR: Slaughter and de-skin the meat. Hang to drain the blood. Trim the fat. Cut the boar open. Season the pig with salt and a special sauce (oregano, salt and herbs). Puncture boar with wires and attach it to clamps. The way he roasts it is to ensure the meat cooks evenly. Add clamp over fire with pig. Rotate every 3-5 minutes. When close to ready, add Adobe (made from chile guajillo blended with garlic, cumin, salt and onions sauce and cut meat. Serve with salsa, guacamole & tortillas. 

üá≤üáΩ GRASSHOPPER SOUP: Pour grasshoppers into a pot with water. Place on fire and allow it to boil. When it‚Äôs cool, blend the grasshoppers then strain the liquid into a separate pot. Only the concentrated liquid Is used because the other part is too crunchy and has grasshopper legs. Add homemade salsa made from a blend of four different chile peppers to the broth and stir. Pour into boil and sprinkle more grasshoppers on top . Serve with cilantro and cut onions similar to consom√© de barbacoa.

üá≤üáΩ LION MEAT: Place the Lion meat on grill and add salt. Continue flipping until completely cooked.

üí∏ PRICE: Lion meat - 330 pesos / $16.50

1. LA VIGA MARKET
ADDRESS: Eje 6 Sur 560, √Årea Federal Central de Abastos, Iztapalapa

üá≤üáΩ FRIED ANCHOVIES: Deep-fry anchovies and add chilies. 

üí∏ PRICE: 40.25 pesos / $1.93 USD 

2. EL PARA√çSO 
ADDRESS: La Viga Market 

üåÆ  OCTOPUS TACOS: Boil octopus in water. Prepare herbs (oregano, bay leaves, thyme, cloves and rosemary) and add to boiling water with an orange. Add in pan with butter, salt and olive oil. Take the boiled octopus out of the pot and chop it up. Put chopped octopus in a bowl and add garlic paste, pepper, talla sauce and olive oil. 

üí∏ PRICE: 280 pesos - 300 pesos / $13 - $14.35 USD per plate 

3. EL ERIZO LOCO RESTAURANT
ADDRESS: La Viga Market 
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Rogelio Hernandez 

üá≤üáΩ STUFFED BARRACUDA: Scale and clean the barracuda. Score on both sides. Season with herbs and lemon pepper on both sides and into the ridges. On aluminum foil, place sliced onions, tomatoes and sweet potatoes. Place sweet potatoes in ridges and stuff sliced carrots in the barracuda. Add sliced potatoes, red bell peppers, choko, zucchini, broccoli and mushrooms. Sprinkle oregano. Add holy herbs, worcestershire sauce and Maggi sauce. Drizzle olive oil and spread on garlic herb butter. Add shredded manchego cheese. Wrap barracuda and place on grill for 15 - 20 minutes.

üí∏ PRICE: 380 pesos / $18.19 USD 

üá≤üáΩ MANTA RAY AL PASTOR: On a flat grill, add olive oil then sliced onions. Add garlic, lard and herb butter and mix. Sprinkle cumin and black pepper. Add fine herbs and diced pineapples. Make a part in the center of the ingredients and add manta ray. Chop up cleaned, boiled manta ray on the grill then pour on special salsa. Mix everything together on the grill. Add salt and Worcestershire sauce.

üí∏ PRICE: 195 pesos / $9.33 USD 

4. BOCA DEL R√çO RESTAURANT 
ADDRESS: La Viga Market 
INTERVIEWEE: Chef Irma Hernandez 

üç≤ STONE SOUP: Put rocks over fire on the stove to heat them up. Fillet the shark. In a special Oaxacan bowl, add plantain leaves, then chili paste. Add the shark fillet. Add shrimps. Add sliced purple onions. Add sliced tomatoes, sliced jalape√±os and bay leaves. Sprinkle on epazote (Mexican tea leaves). Add dried cilantro and rock salt. Bring to table & add water and hot rocks. Wait 7 minutes until the rocks cook the ingredients. 

üí∏ PRICE: 230 pesos / $11.00 USD 

üá≤üáΩ MIXIOTE WITH SHARK: Grill leaves - to make it more flexible. Season fillet with salt and pepper. Dip in salsa and put on a flat top to cook. On the side, stack green banana leaves, then the clear maguey leaves, then stack first shark fillet. Add salsa, octopus, shrimp, purple onion, tomatoes, sliced habaneros, salt, avocado leaves, saint herbs and salsa. Put in a clay cooking vessel. Add consomm√©. Wrap in foil. Place over fire for 15 minutes. 

üí∏ PRICE: 1000 pesos / $47.84 pesos for large size

NEPALESE CUISINE

1. BIBEK‚ÄôS FAMILY HOME
INTERVIEWEES: Bikash, Biddhya & Narayan

ü´ñTEA: Pour water, tea, masala and milk in a pot and boil well. 

üç©SEL ROTI (NEPALI DONUT): Soak the rice in water for 24 hours. Blend soaked rice, sugar & ghee. Pour dough into a bowl. Mold the donuts and place in a frying pan with oil.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. MOMO SPOT
ADDRESS: 3635 North Belt Line Road, Irving, TX 75062
OPERATION HOURS: 09:15AM - 09:15PM
INTERVIEWEE: ÔªøPrakash 

üá≥üáµSTEAMED MOMO: Wrap & then steam in the water for 8-10 minutes.

üá≥üáµKOTHEY MOMO: Make stuffing with ginger, garlic, chicken, cilantro, meat masala, chopped onion, chili powder, butter, oil, salt and pepper. Use dumpling wrappers. Mix together tomato, ginger, garlic, turmeric, chili, coriander, cilantro & sheeshum masala. 

üí∏ PRICE: Steamed Momo - $5.99 USD | Fried Momo & Kothey Momo - $7.99 USD each 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
3. THE GURKHA BAR & GRILL
ADDRESS: 1060 N Main St #118, Euless, TX 76039, United States
INTERVIEWEES: Bibek & his parents 

üá≥üáµGOAT CURRY: Slice an onion. In a massive pot, add olive oil, cinnamon sticks, cloves, bay leaves, red chili peppers, cardamom, cloves & black peppercorn. Add sliced onion and ginger garlic paste. Add a mixture of seasonings, tomato sauce and water. 

üá≥üáµHYAKULO: Grill over tandoor oven. Cook on a clay oven or a barbeque grill. Serve with a special chutney made with coriander, mint, Szechuan pepper, red chili pepper, and salt.

üá≥üáµHEAD & FOOT SOUP: Heat oil in a pan. Add a tablespoon of whole cumin seeds, whole red chili pepper, black pepper. Add the chopped onions & cook until golden brown, then add minced ginger & garlic. Add turmeric powder and salt. Add meat and mix. Allow it to cook for a few minutes then add water. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, stir & let it simmer for 3-4 hours.

üá≥üáµINTESTINES: Clean the intestine. Boil the intestines and belly for at least 7 minutes and wash it again. Cut the small intestine and belly into small pieces and the liver, heart and kidney of the meat into cubes. Heat oil. Add whole cumin seeds, whole red pepper, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, star anise, green cardamom and cloves to the hot oil. Add minced ginger and garlic and saut√© until golden brown. Add turmeric powder, salt and pepper. Fry the belly and intestines over medium heat. Add liver, heart and the kidney and cook for another 15-20 minutes. Garnish with chopped coriander and serve with beaten rice and tomato chutney.

snippet.description:

LEGENDARY TEXAS BBQ 

1. THE ORIGINAL BLACK‚ÄôS BARBECUE 
SOCIAL: @blacksbbq
WEBSITE: https://www.blacksbbq.com/
ADDRESS: 215 North Main Street, Lockhart, Texas 78644
OPERATION HOURS: Sun - Thurs 10AM - 8PM | Fri - Sat 10AM - 8:30PM

The Original Black‚Äôs Barbecue is the oldest in Texas, run by the same family since 1932. 3rd Generation Pitmaster Kent Black slow smokes all Barbecue the way his grandfather did in 1932. A simple rub, local Post Oak Wood and patience is the secret. Their brisket is truly legendary. 

ü§§ HOMEMADE SAUSAGE: Black‚Äôs BBQ‚Äôs 80 year old recipe and techniques remain the same as each ring is hand stuffed and hand tied, then smoked to perfection. Take the brisket trimmings and chop them up, then place them in a mixer. Along with the chopped meat, add the mixture (salt, pepper, and a flour based binder) and water. Fine grind it so it comes out looking almost like hamburger meat. Pour into the stuffer. Stuff the casings with ground meat. Cut and tie them. Place in the smoker and allow them to smoke for about an hour. 

üí∏PRICE: $3.99 per ring

ü•© BRISKET: Take raw brisket and trim off the fat. Begin by cutting some of the lean end off (this meat is used for sausage). Trim off the edges to make it round and make it more aerodynamic, which helps give the brisket less chance to burn. Cut off 2/3 of the hard fat. Continue trimming. Add Blacks secret seasoning, which includes special salt and pepper, red pepper, cayenne and secrets, and massage into the fibers of the meat. Place the raw brisket in the smoker and allow it to smoke for 6 hours. After the first cook, let the meat rest by removing the brisket and placing it in a walk-in cooler to dry-age for a few days. After dry-aging, it‚Äôs time for the second cook. Place the brisket back in the smoker for another roughly 6 hours, until your brisket is mouth-wateringly perfect. Don‚Äôt forget to enjoy it with Black‚Äôs infamous Norma Jean‚Äôs Original BBQ Sauce! 

üí∏PRICE: $22.99 per pound

HMONG FARM-TO-TABLE DINNER 

1. FAMILY FARM
ADDRESS: Wisconsin, USA 

BOILED CHICKEN WITH HMONG HERBS: Boil the chickens. Mix in some Hmong herbs and then eat with rice. 

FRESH POTBELLY PORK WITH SQUASH TIPS: In a massive pot, brown the chopped up pork meat. Drain the oil. Add water to cover the pork and allow it to continue cooking. Add salt and MSG. Boil for about ten minutes then add buttercup squash tips. 

BRAISED GUINEA FOWL: Chop cilantro and green onions. Chop up the guinea fowl. In a big bowl, place chopped guinea fowl, add fresh cilantro and green onions, and add fresh ground pepper. Mix and braise.

BUTTERCUP SQUASH: Cut the buttercup squash. Make the pepper dipping sauce for the meat: mash fresh chili peppers and salt, add roasted garlic, add sugar, add charred green onion, add roasted cherry tomatoes, add fish sauce and add fresh cilantro.

üêü FRIED TILAPIA: Score the fish and pour in Mama Wiilo‚Äôs secret sauce (including vinegar, hot sauce, saffron and gedo masala). Fry until golden brown.

ü´ñ SHAAH: Pour water into a teapot and bring to a boil. Pour in sugar, four scoops of black tea and nutmeg. Pour into a smaller container and add ginger and ground cardamom. Mix well. Pour back into a big tea pot. Pour tea through the strainer and then into a frothing cup. Add half and half and froth.

üêñ ROASTED PIGLET: Roasted the piglet on charcoal for one hour. Add oyster sauce and BBQ sauce on the pork. Cut it into bite-sized pieces and place it on a bamboo tray. Served with fermented shrimp paste (diluted with lemongrass, sugar, and lime). 

üêñ BOILED & STUFFED INTESTINES: Boil the intestine and keep it warm in tin foil. Stuff the intestine with pork blood, minced pork, seasonings, and grill it with the piglet. Cut in thin slices. Serve with fermented shrimp paste (diluted with lemongrass, sugar, and lime). 

üêñ PIGLET BONE SOUP WITH YAM: Simmer the bone with yam. Add thorny cilantro and mint when it starts boiling. Serve with fish sauce, chillies and vermicelli.

ADDRESS: 109  U C∆° Street, Ward 9, Tan Binh District

ü¶ÜROASTED DUCK: Clean and wash the duck. Mix the duck with soy sauce, wood ear mushrooms, dried needle mushrooms and pepper buds. Tie with a string. Boil the duck and dip in cashew oil and honey liquid. Rub salt on the duck‚Äôs neck and insert oxygen inside the duck. Hang on the rack, dry and refrigerate for two hours. Place in a roasting machine for 40 minutes.
Torch the duck. Plating: Pour the juices out of the duck. Use it as the dipping sauce later. Chop the duck into small pieces and serve with banh mi or fried buns.

üí∏PRICE: 380.000 VND / $16.50 USD

ADDRESS: 157 V√µ VƒÉn T·∫ßn Street, Ward 6, District 3

ü¶ÜDUCK SKIN ROLLS: Cut the duck skin in square shaped pieces. Roll it in the mung bean rice paper with cucumber and leaks. Serve with hoisin sauce.

ü¶ÜTOSSED DUCK BONES WITH HOMEMADE SALT: Chop the duck into small pieces. Flesh out the duck meat. Boil the duck bones. Cover with frying flour and deep fry. Stir-fry with garlic, pepper, scallion and butter. Add homemade salt on top and it's ready to serve.

ü¶ÜSTIR-FRIED FLAT NOODLES WITH DUCK MEAT: Deep fry the duck meat and then stir-fry them with flat rice noodles, bean sprouse, dark soy sauce, chives, MSG and other seasoning. Top up with sesame seeds and serve.

snippet.title: The SECRET FOODS of Vietnam's Tay Tribe!!! Rare Village Cooking!! | TRIBAL VIETNAM EP8
snippet.description:
üé• SECOND CHANNEL!!! MORE BEFRS ¬ª http://bit.ly/2pQYjvM‚Äã

TAY VILLAGE FEAST

1. BAC HA MARKET
ADDRESS: Bac Ha Township, Bac Ha District, Lao Cai Province
 
üáªüá≥CORN STEAMED PUDDING: After grinding the corn and mixing with lime water, steam the corn mixture in the mold. Cut in bite-sized pieces. Add pickled cabbage, ground peanuts, pickled juice, and fresh herbs. Top with MSG and seasoning powder.
 
üáªüá≥FIVE-COLORED STICKY RICE: Soak the sticky rice with Magenta leaves for various colors. Steam the rice in a hollow tree trunk pot. Wrap the sticky rice with a phyllium leaf and add a mixture of ground sesame seeds and salt.

üáªüá≥FRIED POUNDED STICKY RICE CAKE: After pounding the rice, either crispy fry it or serve it plain. Fry two sides of the pounded sticky rice cake. Cut it into bite sizes.
 
üáªüá≥FRIED MUNG BEAN RICE CAKE: Take a small piece of rice flour and add mung bean paste as the filling. Sprinkle sesame seeds on the outside. Deep fry until it turns golden brown. 
 
üí∏PRICE: Corn Steamed Pudding & Colored Sticky Rice - 10.000 VND / $0.4 USD each | Fried Sticky Rice Cake - 5.000 VND / $0.2 USD | Fried Mung Bean Cake - 3.000 VND / $0.15 USD
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. MR KIEN AND MRS LUYEN‚ÄôS FAMILY
ADDRESS: Na Lo Village, Bac Ha Township, Lao Cai Province
 
üêñROTISSERIE PIGLET: Stuff with Clausena indica leaves and season with Thai pepper, salt, MSG and ground pepper. Rotisserie for four to five hours. Regularly spray water on the skin. Take out the leaves and squeeze for dipping sauce, then cut the meat in bite sizes.
 
üêñFRIED PORK SHOULDER: Blanch the piglet shoulder in the broth with fermented rice, ginger, lemongrass, lime leaves, Thai pepper, and dried shallots. Fry it in a pan with pork fat. 
 
üêñTAY TRADITIONAL BRAISED PORK BELLY: Blanch the pork belly in the broth with fermented rice, ginger, lemongrass, lime leaves, Thai pepper, and dried shallots. Pierce pieces of pork belly with bamboo skewers. Dip the meat in a bowl of vinegar and honey. Fry in pork fat and then boil in the blanch broth again. Cut into one-inch slices and season with ground pepper, Thai pepper, ginger, rice wine, Tay fermented soya paste, Tay fermented soya bean, fish sauce, MSG and seasoning powder. Stack up 8 even pieces. Put it neatly in a bowl. Add pickled cabbage on top and braise in a bowl in a steamer for 2 hours.
 
üáªüá≥BLACK STICKY RICE: Soak the sticky rice and mung bean for eight hours. Grill the bark and ‚ÄúN√∫c n√°c‚Äù tree branches. Smash it to ash, and mix with the sticky rice. Season the pork belly with a mixture of prickly ash, Thai pepper seeds, MSG, salt. Add ‚Äúdong‚Äù leaves or Phrynium leaves. Scoop a bowl of dyed sticky rice, mung bean, and finish with slices of pork belly. Wrap it up, and use a straw to tighten it. Cook it in boiling water for 6 hours. Allow it to cool down for 6 to 8 hours.

NUNG PHO

1. MRS DUI‚ÄôS FAMILY HOME
ADDRESS: Si Ma Cai District, Lao Cai Province
 
üáªüá≥HORSE OFFAL SOUP: Stir-fry horse cuts (heart, liver, small intestine, etc) with salt and MSG. Add cardamom and star anise. Add water and wait for the soup to boil. Season with ginger and cinnamon. Simmer for 20 minutes and add horse blood. Finally, top up with lime leaves, lemongrass, extra ginger, and shallots. Serve with chili dipping sauce.
 
üáªüá≥STEAMED PHO SHEET: Soak the white and red rice overnight. Grind it twice using a machine. Cook part of the liquid to have a smooth rice paste. Add the paste to the silky liquid then on a flat surface to steam. Cover with a cheesecloth. Remove after 2 minutes and then cut the noodles evenly. 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2. CAN CAU MARKET
 
üêñDRY PHO WITH PIG FACE: Steam a whole pig face for 2 hours. Blanch the pho sheet. Add herbs including mint & basil. Season with MSG, seasoning powder and ground pepper. Top up with pig eyeballs, tongue, cheeks and ear cuts. Serve alongside pickled cabbage.
 
üí∏PRICE: 30.000 VND / $1.3 USD
